intro: Tetradymia spinosa, commonly known as the spiny tetradymia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky slopes. It features narrow, spiny leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its adaptations to harsh conditions make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
